member.name: T:SkiaSharp.GRBackend
member.summary: Possible 3D APIs that may be used by Ganesh.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTarget
member.summary: Wrap an existing render target created by the client in the 3D API.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The client is responsible for ensuring that the underlying 3D API object lives at least as long as the <xref:SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTarget> object wrapping it.
We require the client to explicitly provide information about the target, such as width, height, and pixel configuration, rather than querying the 3D API for these values. We expect these properties to be immutable even if the 3D API doesn't require this (eg: OpenGL).

member.param: The backend to use.
The description of the backend render target.
member.summary: Creates a new with the properties from the specified description.

member.param: The width of the render target in pixels.
The height of the render target in pixels.
The Direct3D texture resource information.
member.summary: Creates a new Direct3D with the specified properties and texture.

member.param: The width of the render target in pixels.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.GRBackendTextureDesc
member.summary: Wrap an existing texture created by the client in the 3D API with an underlying GRTexture object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The client is responsible for ensuring that the texture lives at least as long as the GRTexture object wrapping it.
We require the client to explicitly provide information about the texture, such as width, height, and pixel configuration, rather than querying the 3D API for these values. We expect these to be immutable even if the 3D API doesn't require this (OpenGL).
Textures that are also render targets are supported as well. Any ancillary 3D API (stencil buffer, FBO id, etc) objects necessary will be managed.

member.value: One of the enumeration values that specifies the color format.

member.returns: if the specified object is equal to the current instance; otherwise, .

member.param: Use true to indicate that the underlying 3D context is not yet lost and the will cleanup all allocated resources before returning. Using false will ensure that the destructors of the and any of its created resource objects will not make backend 3D API calls.
member.summary: Abandons all GPU resources and assumes the underlying backend 3D API context is no longer usable. After returning it will assume that the underlying context may no longer be valid.

member.param: The maximum number of bytes of video memory that can be held in the cache.
member.summary: Specifies the GPU resource cache limit.
member.remarks: If the current cache exceeds this limit, it will be purged (LRU) to keep the cache within this limit.

The maximum number of bytes of video memory that can be held in the cache.
member.summary: Specify the GPU resource cache limits.
member.remarks: If the current cache exceeds either of these, it will be purged (LRU) to keep the cache within these limits.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions
member.summary: Represents the collection of options for the construction of a context.

member.name: C:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.AllowPathMaskCaching
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow path mask textures to be cached.
member.value: if path mask textures can be cached; otherwise, .
member.remarks: This is only really useful if paths are commonly rendered at the same scale and fractional translation. Default is .

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.AvoidStencilBuffers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to avoid allocating stencil buffers.
member.value: if stencil buffer allocation should be avoided; otherwise, .
member.remarks: Bugs on certain drivers cause stencil buffers to leak. This flag causes Skia to avoid allocating stencil buffers and use alternate rasterization paths, avoiding the leak.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.BufferMapThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold, in bytes, above which a buffer mapping API will be used to map vertex and index buffers to CPU memory in order to update them.
member.value: The threshold in bytes for buffer mapping.
member.remarks: A value of -1 means the context should deduce the optimal value for this platform. Default is -1.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.DoManualMipmapping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to construct mipmaps manually, via repeated downsampling draw-calls.
member.value: if mipmaps should be constructed manually; otherwise, .
member.remarks: This is used when the driver's implementation (glGenerateMipmap) contains bugs. This requires mipmap level and LOD control (for example, desktop or ES3). Default is .

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.GlyphCacheTextureMaximumBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of cache textures used for the SkiaSharp Glyph cache.
member.value: The maximum size in bytes of cache textures for the glyph cache.
member.remarks: Default is 2048 * 1024 * 4.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.RuntimeProgramCacheSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of GPU programs that may be cached.
member.value: The number of GPU programs that may be cached. Default is 256.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.GRGlBackendTextureDesc
member.summary: Wrap an existing OpenGL texture created by the client in the 3D API with an underlying GRTexture object.

remarks.para: The client is responsible for ensuring that the texture lives at least as long as the GRTexture object wrapping it.

We require the client to explicitly provide information about the texture, such as width, height, and pixel configuration, rather than querying the 3D API for these values. We expect these to be immutable even if the 3D API doesn't require this (OpenGL).
Textures that are also render targets are supported as well. Any ancillary 3D API (stencil buffer, FBO id, etc) objects necessary will be managed.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig
member.summary: Various pixel configurations supported.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Alpha16
member.summary: 16-bit alpha channel.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Alpha8
member.summary: 8-bit Alpha.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Alpha8AsAlpha
member.summary: 8-bit alpha stored in the alpha component.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Alpha8AsRed
member.summary: 8-bit alpha stored in the red component.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.AlphaHalf
member.summary: Single 16-bit float channel.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.AlphaHalfAsLum
member.summary: 16-bit half-float alpha stored in the luminance component.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.AlphaHalfAsRed
member.summary: 16-bit half-float alpha stored in the red component.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Bgra8888
member.summary: Premultiplied 32-bit channel. Byte order is BGRA.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Gray8
member.summary: 8-bit grayscale color channel.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Gray8AsLum
member.summary: 8-bit grayscale stored in the luminance component.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Gray8AsRed
member.summary: 8-bit grayscale stored in the red component.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Rg1616
member.summary: Two 16-bit channels (RG).

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Rg88
member.summary: Two 8-bit channels (RG).

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Rgb565
member.summary: 16-bit channel. Byte order is RGB.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Rgb888
member.summary: Premultiplied, opaque 32-bit color with the format RGB, with 8 bits per color component.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Rgb888x
member.summary: Opaque 32-bit color with the format RGB, with 8 bits per color component and 8 unused bits.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig.Rgba1010102
member.summary: Premultiplied 32-bit color with the format RGBA, with 10 bits per color component and 2 bits for the alpha component.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKAlphaType
member.summary: Describes how to interpret the alpha component of a pixel.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKAlphaType.Opaque
member.summary: All pixels are stored as opaque.

summary.para: All pixels have their alpha premultiplied in their color components.
This is the natural format for the rendering target pixels.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKAlphaType.Unknown
member.summary: The alpha type is uninitialized.

summary.para: All pixels have their color components stored without any regard to the alpha. e.g. this is the default configuration for PNG images.
This alpha-type is ONLY supported for input images. Rendering cannot generate this on output.

member.summary: Convenience class used to automatically initialize and uninitialize COM on supported platforms.

remarks.para: This is only supported on Windows, and is usually not needed. However, when creating a .NET Core app, COM may not be initialized.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKBitmap
member.summary: The specifies a raster bitmap.

remarks.para: A bitmap has an integer width and height, and a format (color type), and a pointer to the actual pixels. Bitmaps can be drawn into a , but they are also used to specify the target of a ' drawing operations.

A exposes , which lets a caller write its pixels. To retrieve a pointer to the raw image data of the bitmap, call the method to get a pointer to the image data. The raw data is laid out in the format configured at the time that the bitmap was created.

member.name: C:SkiaSharp.SKBitmap
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with zero width and height, and no pixels. Its color type is set to .
member.remarks: This constructor does not allocate a backing store for the bitmap.

member.name: C:SkiaSharp.SKBitmap(SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo,SkiaSharp.SKColorTable)
member.param: The description of the desired image format.
The color lookup table.
member.summary: Constructor that configures the bitmap based on an specification and a color table.
member.remarks: Use this method to create a bitmap that will use a color lookup table. The bitmap will be an 8-bit indexed bitmap, where each value represents an index into the color table, and the color is determined by the value in the specific location in the color table array.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKBitmap.ScalePixels(SkiaSharp.SKBitmap,SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality)
member.param: The bitmap to receive the scaled and converted pixels.
The level of quality to use when scaling the pixels.
member.summary: Copies this pixmap to the destination, scaling the pixels to fit the destination size and converting the pixels to match the color type and alpha type.
member.returns: Returns on success, or if there was an error.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Pixels are copied only if pixel conversion is possible.
If the color type is <xref:SkiaSharp.SKColorType.Gray8>, or <xref:SkiaSharp.SKColorType.Alpha8>, the destination color type must match. If the color type is <xref:SkiaSharp.SKColorType.Gray8>, destination colorspace must also match.
If the alpha type is <xref:SkiaSharp.SKAlphaType.Opaque>, the destination alpha type must match.
If the colorspace is <see langword="null" />, the destination colorspace must also be <see langword="null" />.
Filter Quality:
- <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality.None> is fastest, typically implemented with nearest neighbor filter. - <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality.Low> is typically implemented with bilerp filter. - <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality.Medium> is typically implemented with bilerp filter, and mipmap when size is reduced. - <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality.High> is slowest, typically implemented with the bicubic filter.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKBitmap.ScalePixels(SkiaSharp.SKBitmap,SkiaSharp.SKSamplingOptions)
member.param: The destination bitmap.
The sampling options for resizing.
member.summary: Scales the pixels to the destination using the sampling options.
member.returns: Returns on success.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKBitmap.ScalePixels(SkiaSharp.SKPixmap,SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality)
member.param: The pixmap to receive the scaled and converted pixels.
The level of quality to use when scaling the pixels.
member.summary: Copies this pixmap to the destination, scaling the pixels to fit the destination size and converting the pixels to match the color type and alpha type.
member.returns: Returns on success, or if there was an error.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Pixels are copied only if pixel conversion is possible.
If the color type is <xref:SkiaSharp.SKColorType.Gray8>, or <xref:SkiaSharp.SKColorType.Alpha8>, the destination color type must match. If the color type is <xref:SkiaSharp.SKColorType.Gray8>, destination colorspace must also match.
If the alpha type is <xref:SkiaSharp.SKAlphaType.Opaque>, the destination alpha type must match.
If the colorspace is <see langword="null" />, the destination colorspace must also be <see langword="null" />.
Filter Quality:
- <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality.None> is fastest, typically implemented with nearest neighbor filter. - <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality.Low> is typically implemented with bilerp filter. - <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality.Medium> is typically implemented with bilerp filter, and mipmap when size is reduced. - <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality.High> is slowest, typically implemented with the bicubic filter.

member.returns: Returns on success.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKBitmap.SetImmutable
member.summary: Marks the bitmap as immutable.
member.remarks: Marks this bitmap as immutable, meaning that the contents of its pixels will not change for the lifetime of the bitmap and of the underlying pixelref. This state can be set, but it cannot be cleared once it is set. This state propagates to all other bitmaps that share the same pixelref.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode
member.summary: Predefined blend modes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
- **Porter Duff Compositing Operators** Defined algebra of compositing. These operators control the results of mixing the four sub-pixel regions formed by the overlapping of graphical objects that have an alpha or pixel coverage channel/value. - **Separable Blend Mode** Each component of the result color is completely determined by the corresponding components of the constituent backdrop and source colors. - **Non-Separable Blend Mode** Considers all color components in combination as opposed to the separable ones that look at each component individually.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Clear
member.summary: No regions are enabled. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_clr.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Color
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color. [Non-Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Dst
member.summary: Only the destination will be present. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.DstATop
member.summary: Destination which overlaps the source replaces the source. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst-atop.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.DstIn
member.summary: Destination which overlaps the source, replaces the source. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst-in.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.DstOut
member.summary: Destination is placed, where it falls outside of the source. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst-out.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.DstOver
member.summary: Destination is placed over the source. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst-over.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color. [Non-Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color. [Non-Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Modulate
member.summary: Multiplies all components (= alpha and color). [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: The source color is multiplied by the destination color and replaces the destination [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Plus
member.summary: Display the sum of the source image and destination image. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Saturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color. [Non-Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Src
member.summary: Only the source will be present. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_src.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.SrcATop
member.summary: Source which overlaps the destination, replaces the destination. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_src-atop.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.SrcIn
member.summary: The source that overlaps the destination, replaces the destination. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_src-in.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.SrcOut
member.summary: Source is placed, where it falls outside of the destination. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_src-out.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.SrcOver
member.summary: Source is placed over the destination. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_src-over.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Xor
member.summary: The non-overlapping regions of source and destination are combined. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_xor.svg)

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.Discard
member.summary: Makes the canvas contents undefined.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Subsequent calls that read the canvas pixels, such as drawing with <xref:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode>, return undefined results. Calling this method does not change clip or matrix and may do nothing, depending on the implementation of the underlying <xref:SkiaSharp.SKSurface>.
<xref:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.Discard> allows optimized performance on subsequent draws by removing cached data associated with the underlying <xref:SkiaSharp.SKSurface>. It is not necessary to call <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.Discard> once done with <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas>; any cached data is deleted when the owning <xref:SkiaSharp.SKSurface> is deleted.

member.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.remarks: Always dispose the object before you release your last reference to the . Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the finalizer.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.DrawPicture(SkiaSharp.SKPicture,SkiaSharp.SKMatrix@,SkiaSharp.SKPaint)
member.param: The picture to draw.
The matrix to apply while painting.
The paint to use when drawing the picture, or .
member.summary: Draws a picture on the canvas.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This is equivalent to calling <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.Save>, followed by <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.Concat(SkiaSharp.SKMatrix@)> with the specified `matrix`, <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.DrawPicture(SkiaSharp.SKPicture,SkiaSharp.SKPaint)> and then <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.Restore>.
If paint is non-null, the picture is drawn into a temporary buffer, and then the paint's alpha, color filter, image filter, blend mode are applied to that buffer as it is drawn to the canvas.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.DrawPoints(SkiaSharp.SKPointMode,SkiaSharp.SKPoint[],SkiaSharp.SKPaint)
member.param: Determines how the points array will be interpreted: as points, as coordinates to draw lines, or as coordinates of a polygon.
The array of points to draw.
The paint to use when drawing the points.
member.summary: Draws an array of points, lines or a polygon in the canvas, one at a time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
For <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPointMode.Points>, each point is drawn centered at its coordinate, and its size is specified by the paint's stroke-width. It draws as a square, unless the paint's <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPaint.StrokeCap> is <xref:SkiaSharp.SKStrokeCap.Round>, in which the points are drawn as circles.
For <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPointMode.Lines>, each pair of points is drawn as a line segment, respecting the paint's settings for cap, join and width.
For <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPointMode.Polygon>, the entire array is drawn as a series of connected line segments.
Note that, while similar, the line and polygon modes draw slightly differently than the equivalent path built with a series of move to, line to calls, in that the path will draw all of its contours at once, with no interactions if contours intersect each other (think <xref:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Xor>).

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.Restore
member.summary: Restore the canvas state.
member.remarks: This call balances a previous call to , and is used to remove all modifications to the matrix, clip and draw filter state since the last save call. It is an error to restore more times than was previously saved.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.RestoreToCount(System.Int32)
member.param: The number of levels to restore from, or -1 to restore all the way back to the initial value.
member.summary: Efficiently restores the state to a specific level.
member.remarks: Efficient way to pop any calls to that happened after the save count reached . It is an error for to be greater than . To pop all the way back to the initial matrix/clip context set count to -1.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.Save
member.summary: Saves the canvas state.
member.returns: The value to pass to to balance this save.
member.remarks: This call saves the current matrix, clip, and draw filter, and pushes a copy onto a private stack. Subsequent calls to translate, scale, rotate, skew, concatenate or clipping path or drawing filter all operate on this copy. When the balancing call to is made, the previous matrix, clipping, and drawing filters are restored.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.SaveCount
member.summary: Gets the number of matrix/clip states on the canvas' private stack.
member.value: The number of saved states on the stack.
member.remarks: This will equal the number of calls minus calls + 1. The save count on a new canvas is 1.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.SaveLayer
member.summary: Saves the current matrix and clip, and allocates an offscreen buffer for subsequent drawing.
member.returns: The depth of the saved stack, which can be used with .

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.SaveLayer(SkiaSharp.SKCanvasSaveLayerRec@)
member.param: The save layer parameters.
member.summary: Saves the current matrix and clip, and allocates an offscreen buffer using the specified parameters.
member.returns: The depth of the saved stack.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.SaveLayer(SkiaSharp.SKPaint)
member.param: This is copied, and is applied to the offscreen when is called.
member.summary: Saves the canvas state and allocates an offscreen bitmap.
member.returns: The value to pass to to balance this save.
member.remarks: This behaves the same as but in addition it allocates an offscreen bitmap. All drawing calls are directed there, and only when the balancing call to is made is that offscreen transfered to the canvas (or the previous layer).

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.SaveLayer(SkiaSharp.SKRect,SkiaSharp.SKPaint)
member.param: This clipping rectangle hint to limit the size of the offscreen bitmap.
This is copied, and is applied to the offscreen when is called.
member.summary: Saves the canvas state and allocates an offscreen bitmap.
member.returns: The value to pass to to balance this save.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This behaves the same as <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.Save> but in addition it allocates an offscreen bitmap. All drawing calls are directed there, and only when the balancing call to <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.Restore> is made is that offscreen transfered to the canvas (or the previous layer).
The limit rectangle, is used as a hint to limit the size of the offscreen bitmap, and thus drawing may be clipped to it, though that clipping is not guaranteed to happen. If exact clipping is desired, use <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.ClipRect(SkiaSharp.SKRect,SkiaSharp.SKClipOperation,System.Boolean)>.

member.summary: Returns the output y-coordinate of the row that corresponds to an input y-coordinate.
member.returns: Returns the output y-coordinate of the row.
member.remarks: This will equal , except in the case of strangely encoded image types (bottom-up BMPs, interlaced GIFs).

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCodec.GetPixels(System.Byte[]@)
member.param: The memory block with the decoded bitmap.
member.summary: Decode the bitmap into the specified memory block.
member.returns: Returns on success, or another value explaining the type of failure.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCodec.GetPixels(SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo,System.Byte[])
member.param: The description of the desired output format expected by the caller.
The memory block to hold the decoded bitmap, with a length of at least .
member.summary: Decode the bitmap into the specified memory block.
member.returns: Returns on success, or another value explaining the type of failure.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The specified <xref:SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo>, can either be <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCodec.Info>, or a new instance with a different configuration - which the codec may choose to ignore.
If the specified size is different from the size from <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCodec.Info>, then the codec will attempt to scale the resulting bitmap. If the codec cannot perform this scale, this method will return <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult.InvalidScale>.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCodec.GetScaledDimensions(System.Single)
member.param: The desired scale factor.
member.summary: Returns a size that approximately supports the desired scale factor.
member.returns: Returns a supported size.
member.remarks: The codec may not be able to scale efficiently to the exact scale factor requested, so return a size that approximates that scale. Upscaling is not supported, so the original size will be returned.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCodec.GetScanlines(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: The memory location to store the scanlines.
The number of lines to write.
The number of bytes per row.
member.summary: Writes the next set of scanlines into the destination.
member.returns: Returns the number of lines successfully decoded.
member.remarks: If number of lines successfully decoded is less than , this will fill the remaining lines with a default value.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCodec.GetValidSubset(SkiaSharp.SKRectI@)
member.param: The desired subset of the original bounds, which may be modified to a subset which is supported.
member.summary: Modifies the specified subset to one that can decoded from this codec.
member.returns: if this codec supports decoding the desired subset; otherwise, . The final subset can be used with .

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCodec.IncrementalDecode
member.summary: Start or continue the incremental decode.
member.returns: Returns if all lines requested in have been completely decoded. otherwise.
member.remarks: Unlike , this does not do any filling. This is left up to the caller, since they may be skipping lines or continuing the decode later.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCodec.IncrementalDecode(System.Int32@)
member.param: The total number of lines initialized. Only meaningful if this method returns .
member.summary: Start or continue the incremental decode.
member.returns: Returns if all lines requested in have been completely decoded. otherwise.
member.remarks: Unlike , this does not do any filling. This is left up to the caller, since they may be skipping lines or continuing the decode later.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKCodec.RepetitionCount
member.summary: Gets the number of times to repeat, if this image is animated.
member.value: The number of times to repeat the animation.

remarks.para: For infinite repetition of frames, this will be -1.
May require reading the stream to find the repetition count. As such, future decoding calls may require a rewind. For single-frame images, this will be 0.

member.returns: Returns if the scanlines were successfully skipped, otherwise on failure (incomplete input, the number of lines is less than zero, read all the lines).

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKCodecOptions.PriorFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating which frame, if any, the destination bitmap already contains.
member.value: The index of the prior frame, or -1 to indicate no prior frame.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Only meaningful for multi-frame images.
If <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCodecOptions.FrameIndex> needs to be blended with a prior frame (as reported by `SKCodec.FrameInfo[FrameIndex].RequiredFrame`), the client can set this to any non-<xref:SkiaSharp.SKCodecAnimationDisposalMethod.RestorePrevious> frame in the range [RequiredFrame, FrameIndex) to indicate that that frame is already in the destination. <xref:SkiaSharp.SKCodecOptions.ZeroInitialized> is ignored in this case.
If set to -1, the codec will decode any necessary required frame(s) first.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKCodecOptions.Subset
member.summary: Gets or sets the subset rectangle.
member.value: The subset rectangle, or if no subset is specified.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKCodecOptions.ZeroInitialized
member.summary: Gets or sets the zero-initialization.
member.value: The zero-initialization setting.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecOrigin.RightBottom
member.summary: Reflected across x-axis, Rotated 90 clockwise.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecOrigin.RightTop
member.summary: Rotated 90 clockwise.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecOrigin.TopLeft
member.summary: Default.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecOrigin.TopRight
member.summary: Reflected across y-axis.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult
member.summary: Used to describe the result of a call to or one of the overloads that accepts a .
member.remarks: Result is the union of possible results from subclasses.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult.CouldNotRewind
member.summary: Fulfilling this request requires rewinding the input, which is not supported for this input.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult.ErrorInInput
member.summary: There was an error in the imput data. If returned from an incremental decode, decoding cannot continue, even with more data.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult.IncompleteInput
member.summary: The input is incomplete. A partial image was generated.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult.InternalError
member.summary: An internal memory occurred, such as an out-of-memory error.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult.InvalidConversion
member.summary: The codec cannot convert to match the request, ignoring dimensions.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult.InvalidInput
member.summary: The input did not contain a valid image.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult.InvalidParameters
member.summary: The parameters (besides info) are invalid. e.g. null pixels, row bytes too small, etc.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult.InvalidScale
member.summary: The generator cannot scale to requested size.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult.Success
member.summary: The general return value for success.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecResult.Unimplemented
member.summary: This method is not supported by this codec.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKCodecScanlineOrder
member.summary: The orders in which scanlines can be returned.
member.remarks: These values are obtained through the property.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecScanlineOrder.BottomUp
member.summary: Indicates that the scanline decoder reliably outputs rows, but they will be returned in reverse order. The property can be used to determine the actual y-coordinate of the next output row.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKCodecScanlineOrder.TopDown
member.summary: Indicates that the image can be decoded reliably using the scanline decoder, and that rows will be output in the logical order.

member.param: An array of elements.
member.summary: Creates a new color filter that transforms a color by a 4x5 (row-major) matrix.
member.returns: Returns the new .
member.remarks: The matrix is in row-major order and the translation column is specified in unnormalized, 0...255, space.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKColorFilter.CreateCompose(SkiaSharp.SKColorFilter,SkiaSharp.SKColorFilter)
member.param: The outer (second) filter to apply.
The inner (first) filter to apply.
member.summary: Creates a new composition color filter, whose effect is to first apply the inner filter and then apply the outer filter to the result of the inner.
member.returns: Returns the new .

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKColorFilter.CreateHighContrast(SkiaSharp.SKHighContrastConfig)
member.param: The high contrast configuration settings.
member.summary: Creates a new high contrast color filter which provides transformations to improve contrast for users with low vision.
member.returns: Returns the new .
member.remarks: Applies the following transformations in this order: conversion to grayscale, color inversion, increasing the resulting contrast.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKColorFilter.CreateHighContrast(System.Boolean,SkiaSharp.SKHighContrastConfigInvertStyle,System.Single)
member.param: to convert the color to grayscale; otherwise, .
The style of brightness or lightness inversion to apply, or none.
The amount to adjust the contrast by, in the range -1.0 through 1.0.
member.summary: Creates a new high contrast color filter which provides transformations to improve contrast for users with low vision.
member.returns: Returns the new .
member.remarks: Applies the following transformations in this order: conversion to grayscale, color inversion, increasing the resulting contrast.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKColorSpaceTransferFn
member.summary: Represents the coefficients for a common transfer function equation.

remarks.para: The coefficients are specified as a transformation from a curved space to linear.
LinearVal = C*InputVal + F; (for 0.0f <= InputVal < D)
LinearVal = (A*InputVal + B)^G + E; (for D <= InputVal <= 1.0f)
Function is undefined if InputVal is not in [ 0.0f, 1.0f ].
Resulting LinearVals must be in [ 0.0f, 1.0f ].
Function must be positive and increasing.

member.param: The values of the coefficients.
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .
member.remarks: There must be exactly 7 values in the array with the form [G, A, B, C, D, E, F].

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKColorTable
member.summary: Holds a premultiplied color table for indexed 8-bit bitmaps.
member.remarks: This class is used to represent a color lookup table for indexed bitmap images. The table can contain up to (256) colors (8 bits). The colors are stored are premultiplied 32-bit colors.

member.summary: The holds an immutable data buffer.

remarks.para: Not only is the data immutable, but the actual pointer that is returned by the property is guaranteed to always be the same for the life of this instance.
The method can be used to return a that wraps this and allows for .NET APIs to scan the contents of the as a stream.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKDocument
member.summary: A high-level API for creating a document-based canvas.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
For each page, call <xref:SkiaSharp.SKDocument.BeginPage%2A> to get the canvas, and then complete the page with a call to <xref:SkiaSharp.SKDocument.EndPage%2A>. Finally, call <xref:SkiaSharp.SKDocument.Close%2A> to complete the document.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKDocument.Abort
member.summary: Stops producing the document immediately.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKDocument.BeginPage(System.Single,System.Single)
member.param: The width of the page.
The height of the page.
member.summary: Begins a new page for the document, returning the canvas that will draw into the page.
member.returns: Returns a canvas for the new page.
member.remarks: The document owns this canvas, and it will go out of scope when or is called, or the document is deleted.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKDocument.BeginPage(System.Single,System.Single,SkiaSharp.SKRect)
member.param: The width of the page.
The height of the page.
The area for the page contents.
member.summary: Begins a new page for the document, returning the canvas that will draw into the page.
member.returns: Returns a canvas for the new page.
member.remarks: The document owns this canvas, and it will go out of scope when or is called, or the document is deleted.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKDocumentPdfMetadata.EncodingQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding quality.
member.value: The encoding quality, between 0 and 100, or 101 for lossless encoding.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Encoding quality controls the trade-off between size and quality. By default this is set to 101 percent, which corresponds to lossless encoding. If this value is set to a value <= 100, and the image is opaque, it will be encoded (using JPEG) with that quality setting.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKDocumentPdfMetadata.PdfA
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to make the document PDF/A-2b conformant.
member.value: if the document should be PDF/A-2b conformant; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If true, include XMP metadata, a document UUID, and sRGB output intent information. This adds length to the document and makes it non-reproducable, but are necessary features for PDF/A-2b conformance.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKDocumentPdfMetadata.Producer
member.summary: The product that is converting this document to PDF.
member.value: The name of the producer product, or if not set.
member.remarks: Leave empty to get the default, correct value.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKDocumentPdfMetadata.RasterDpi
member.summary: Gets or sets the DPI (pixels-per-inch) at which features without native PDF support will be rasterized.
member.value: The raster DPI value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
PDF pages are sized in point units. 1 pt == 1/72 inch == 127/360 mm.
A larger DPI would create a PDF that reflects the original intent with better fidelity, but it can make for larger PDF files too, which would use more memory while rendering, and it would be slower to be processed or sent online or to printer.

member.value: The subject, or if not set.

member.value: The title, or if not set.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKDrawable
member.summary: Represents the base class for objects that draw into .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The object has a generation ID, which is guaranteed to be unique across all drawables. To allow for clients of the drawable that may want to cache the results, the drawable must change its generation ID whenever its internal state changes such that it will draw differently.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKDrawable.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the conservative bounds of what the drawable will draw.
member.value: The bounding rectangle of the drawable.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the drawable can change what it draws (e.g. animation or in response to some external change), then this must return a bounds that is always valid for all possible states.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKFontEdging
member.summary: Specifies the type of edge smoothing to use when rendering glyphs.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKFontEdging.Alias
member.summary: No edge smoothing; glyphs are rendered with hard, aliased edges.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKFontEdging.Antialias
member.summary: Grayscale antialiasing for smooth edges using alpha blending.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKFontEdging.SubpixelAntialias
member.summary: Subpixel antialiasing that uses LCD pixel geometry for improved clarity on LCD displays.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKFontHinting
member.summary: Specifies the level of hinting to be performed when rendering glyphs.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKFontHinting.Full
member.summary: Use the full amount of hinting for maximum adjustment of glyph outlines to the pixel grid.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKFontHinting.None
member.summary: Do not apply any hinting to glyph outlines.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKFontHinting.Normal
member.summary: Use a normal amount of hinting to improve glyph rendering at small sizes.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKFontHinting.Slight
member.summary: Use slight hinting to improve contrast without changing glyph shapes.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKFontManager.MatchCharacter(System.String,System.String[],System.Char)
member.param: The family name to use when searching.
The ISO 639, 15924, and 3166-1 code to use when searching, such as "ja" and "zh".
The character to find a typeface for.
member.summary: Use the system fallback to find a typeface for the given character.
member.returns: Returns the that contains the given character, or if none was found.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Note that `bcp47` is a combination of ISO 639, 15924, and3166-1 codes, so it is fine to just pass a ISO 639 here. The first item is the least significant fallback, and the last is the most significant.
If no specified codes match, any font with the requested character will be matched.
May return <see langword="null" /> if no family can be found for the character in the system fallback.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKFontManager.MatchCharacter(System.String,System.String[],System.Int32)
member.param: The family name to try and use.

member.summary: Use the system fallback to find a typeface for the given character.
member.returns: Returns the that contains the given character, or if none was found.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.StrikeoutPosition
member.summary: Gets the position of the bottom of the strikeout stroke relative to the baseline.
member.value: The position of the bottom of the strikeout stroke relative to the baseline, or if the font does not have this metric.
member.remarks: This value is typically negative when valid.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.StrikeoutThickness
member.summary: Gets the thickness of the strikeout.
member.value: The thickness of the strikeout, or if the font does not have this metric.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.Top
member.summary: Gets the greatest distance above the baseline for any glyph.
member.value: The greatest distance above the baseline for any glyph.
member.remarks: Will be <= 0.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.UnderlinePosition
member.summary: Gets the position of the top of the underline stroke relative to the baseline.
member.value: The position of the top of the underline stroke relative to the baseline, or if the font does not have this metric.

remarks.para: Negative - underline should be drawn above baseline.
Positive - underline should be drawn below baseline.
Zero - underline should be drawn on baseline.underline position, or 0 if cannot be determined.
null - does not have an UnderlinePosition.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.UnderlineThickness
member.summary: Gets the thickness of the underline.
member.value: The thickness of the underline, or if the font does not have this metric.

remarks.para: 0 - if the thickness can not be determined
null - if the thickness is not set.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKImage
member.summary: An abstraction for drawing a rectangle of pixels.

remarks.para: An image is an abstraction of pixels, though the particular type of image could be actually storing its data on the GPU, or as drawing commands (picture or PDF or otherwise), ready to be played back into another canvas.
The content of an image is always immutable, though the actual storage may change, if for example that image can be recreated via encoded data or other means.
An image always has a non-zero dimensions. If there is a request to create a new image, either directly or via a surface, and either of the requested dimensions are zero, then will be returned.

member.summary: Applies a given image filter to this image, and return the filtered result.
member.returns: Returns the resulting image after the filter is applied, or if the image could not be created or would be transparent black (#00000000).

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKImageFilter.CreateAlphaThreshold(SkiaSharp.SKRectI,System.Single,System.Single,SkiaSharp.SKImageFilter)

The maximum alpha for pixels outside the region.
The input filter to use.
member.summary: Creates an image filter that samples a region.

This should not be called with <xref:SkiaSharp.SKMaskFormat.BW>, as it will give unspecified results.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKMatrix44.MapVector2(System.Single[])
member.param: The array of [x, y] pairs. The array must have an entry count of a multiple of 2.
member.summary: Applies the matrix to a series of [x, y] pairs, returning the [x', y', z', w'] result.
member.returns: Returns the resulting [x', y', z', w'] sets.

remarks.para: The source array must have an entry count of a multiple of 2 (2, 4, 6, 8, ...). The resulting array will have an entry count of a multiple of 4 (4, 8, 12, 16, ...).
The source array has an implied z-value of 0 and a w-value of 1, equivalent to [x, y, 0, 1].

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKMatrix44.MapVector2(System.Single[],System.Single[])
member.param: The array of [x, y] pairs. The array must have an entry count of a multiple of 2.

member.remarks: The source array has an implied z-value of 0 and a w-value of 1, equivalent to [x, y, 0, 1].

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKMatrix44.Preserves2DAxisAlignment(System.Single)
member.param: The amount of error to allow for when determining axis-alignment.
member.summary: Determines if transforming an axis-aligned square in 2D by this matrix will produce another 2D, axis-aligned square.
member.returns: Returns if the matrix preserves 2D axis alignment, otherwise .
member.remarks: If the result is , it typically means the matrix is a scale with perhaps a 90-degree rotation. A 3D rotation through 90 degrees into a perpendicular plane collapses a square to a line, but is still considered to be axis-aligned.

member.summary: Represents a native object.
member.remarks: This object just wraps a native handle with the managed dispose pattern. For a tracked object, use .

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this .
member.remarks: Always dispose the object before you release your last reference to the . Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the finalizer.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.remarks: Always dispose the object before you release your last reference to the . Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the finalizer.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.DisposeInternal
member.summary: Triggers a dispose, ignoring the value of .

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.DisposeManaged
member.summary: Implemented by derived types to destroy any managed objects.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.DisposeNative
member.summary: Implemented by derived types to destroy any native objects.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.DisposeUnownedManaged
member.summary: Implemented by derived types to dispose managed objects that are not owned by this instance.
member.remarks: This method is called during disposal to clean up managed objects that were created by native code but are not owned by this instance.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.Finalize
member.summary: Allows an object to try to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.Handle

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.IgnorePublicDispose
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the call the public should be no-op.
member.value: if the public Dispose call should be ignored; otherwise, .
member.remarks: This only affects the public disposal. Objects that own this one can still forcefull trigger a dispose using .

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the object has already been disposed.
member.value: if the object has been disposed; otherwise, .

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKNativeObject.OwnsHandle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this object owns its handle and should destroy the native object when it is disposed.
member.value: if the object owns the handle and will destroy it when disposed; otherwise, .

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKPaintStyle
member.summary: Indications on how to draw geometry.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Styles apply to rectangle, oval, path, and text. Bitmaps are always drawn in <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPaintStyle.Fill>, and lines are always drawn in <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPaintStyle.Stroke>.
<xref:SkiaSharp.SKPaintStyle.StrokeAndFill> implicitly draws the result with <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPathFillType.Winding> so if the original path is even-odd, the results may not appear the same as if it was drawn twice, filled and then stroked.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKPaintStyle.Stroke
member.summary: Stroke the geometry.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKPaintStyle.StrokeAndFill
member.summary: Fill and stroke the geometry.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.ArcTo(SkiaSharp.SKRect,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.param: The bounding oval defining the shape and size of the arc.
The starting angle (in degrees) where the arc begins.
The sweep angle (in degrees) measured clockwise.
Whether to always begin a new contour with the arc.
member.summary: Appends the specified arc to the path.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the start of the arc is different from the path's current last point, then an automatic <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.LineTo%2A> is added to connect the current contour to the start of the arc. However, if the path is empty, then we call <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.MoveTo%2A> with the first point of the arc.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKPath.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the path's points. If the path contains zero points/verbs, this will return the empty rectangle.
member.value: Gets the bounds of the path's points.
member.remarks: This bounds may be larger than the actual shape, since curves do not extend as far as their control points. Additionally this bound encompasses all points, even isolated MoveTo either preceding or following the last non-degenerate contour.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.Close
member.summary: Closes the current contour.
member.remarks: If the current point is not equal to the first point of the contour, a line segment is automatically added.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.ComputeTightBounds
member.summary: Computes a bounds that is conservatively "snug" around the path.
member.returns: Returns the bounds.

remarks.para: This assumes that the path will be filled.
It does not attempt to collapse away contours that are logically empty (e.g. MoveTo(x, y) + LineTo(x, y)) but will include them in the calculation.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.CreateIterator(System.Boolean)
member.param: When is , each contour (as defined by a new starting move command) will be completed with a close verb regardless of the contour's contents.
member.summary: Creates an iterator object to scan the all of the segments (lines, quadratics, cubics) of each contours in a path.
member.returns: Returns an object that can be used to iterate over the various elements of the path.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This iterator is able to clean up the path as the values are returned. If you do not desire to get verbs that have been cleaned up, use the <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.CreateRawIterator%2A> method instead.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.CreateRawIterator
member.summary: Creates a raw iterator object to scan the all of the segments (lines, quadratics, cubics) of each contours in a path.
member.returns: Returns an object that can be used to iterate over the various elements of the path.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Unlike the <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.CreateIterator%2A> method, this iterator does not clean up or normalize the values in the path. It returns the raw elements contained in the path.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.QuadTo(SkiaSharp.SKPoint,SkiaSharp.SKPoint)
member.param: The coordinates of the control point on a quadratic curve.
The coordinates of the end point on a quadratic curve.
member.summary: Adds a quadratic bezier from the last point.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Adds a quadratic bezier from the last point, approaching control point (`point0`), and ending at `point1`.
If no <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.MoveTo%2A> call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0, 0).

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.QuadTo(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.param: The x-coordinate of the control point on a quadratic curve.
The y-coordinate of the control point on a quadratic curve.
The x-coordinate of the end point on a quadratic curve.
The y-coordinate of the end point on a quadratic curve.
member.summary: Adds a quadratic bezier from the last point.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Adds a quadratic bezier from the last point, approaching control point (`x0`, `y0`), and ending at (`x1`, `y1`).
If no <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPath.MoveTo%2A> call has been made for this contour, the first point is automatically set to (0, 0).

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.Reset

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.Rewind
member.summary: Clear any lines and curves from the path, making it empty.
member.remarks: Any internal storage for those lines/curves is retained, making reuse of the path potentially faster.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKPathAddMode.Append
member.summary: Source path contours are added as new contours.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKPathAddMode.Extend
member.summary: The path is added by extending the last contour of the destination path with the first contour of the source path. If the last contour of the destination path is closed, then it will not be extended. Instead, the start of source path will be extended by a straight line to the end point of the destination path.

member.param: The outer (second) path effect to apply.
The inner (first) path effect to apply.
member.summary: Creates a compound path effect.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPathEffect.CreateCorner(System.Single)
member.param: The radius to use, must be > 0 to have an effect.
member.summary: Creates a path effect that can turn sharp corners into various treatments (e.g. rounded corners).
member.returns: Returns the new , or on error.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPathEffect.CreateDash(System.Single[],System.Single)
member.param: The definition of the dash pattern via an even number of entries.
The offset into the intervals array. (mod the sum of all of the intervals).
member.summary: Creates a dash path effect by specifying the dash intervals.
member.returns: Returns the new , or on error.

remarks.para: The dash pattern is defined via an array containing an even number of entries (>=2), with the even indices specifying the length of "on" intervals, and the odd indices specifying the length of "off" intervals.

For example: if the intervals = new [] { 10, 20 } and the phase = 25, then the dash pattern will be: 5 pixels off, 10 pixels on, 20 pixels off, 10 pixels on, 20 pixels off, etc. A phase of -5, 25, 55, 85, etc. would all result in the same path, because the sum of all the intervals is 30.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPathEffect.CreateDiscrete(System.Single,System.Single,System.UInt32)
member.param: The length of the segments to break the path into.
The maximum distance to move the point away from the original path.
The randomizer seed to use.
member.summary: Creates a "jitter" path effect by chopping a path into discrete segments, and randomly displacing them.
member.returns: Returns the new , or on error.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPathEffect.CreateSum(SkiaSharp.SKPathEffect,SkiaSharp.SKPathEffect)
member.param: The first path effect to apply.
The second path effect to apply.
member.summary: Creates a compound path effect.
member.returns: Returns the new , or on error.
member.remarks: The effect is to apply one path after the other.

member.returns: Returns the new , or on error.
member.remarks: If either the start or stop values are outside the [0, 1] range (inclusive), they will be pinned to the nearest legal value.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPictureRecorder.EndRecording
member.summary: Signal that the caller is done recording.
member.returns: Returns the containing the recorded content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This invalidates the canvas returned by <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPictureRecorder.BeginRecording%2A> and <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPictureRecorder.RecordingCanvas>.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPictureRecorder.EndRecordingAsDrawable
member.summary: Signal that the caller is done recording.
member.returns: Returns the containing the recorded content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This invalidates the canvas returned by <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPictureRecorder.BeginRecording%2A> and <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPictureRecorder.RecordingCanvas>.
Unlike <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPictureRecorder.EndRecording%2A>, which returns an immutable picture, the returned drawable may contain live references to other drawables (if they were added to the recording canvas) and therefore this drawable will reflect the current state of those nested drawables anytime it is drawn or a new picture is snapped from it (by calling <xref:SkiaSharp.SKDrawable.Snapshot%2A>).

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKPictureRecorder.RecordingCanvas
member.summary: Gets the current recording canvas.
member.value: The recording canvas.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPixmap.ScalePixels(SkiaSharp.SKPixmap)
member.param: The destination pixmap.
member.summary: Scales pixels to the destination using default sampling.
member.returns: Returns on success.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPixmap.ScalePixels(SkiaSharp.SKPixmap,SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality)
member.param: The pixmap to receive the scaled and converted pixels.
The level of quality to use when scaling the pixels.
member.summary: Copies this pixmap to the destination, scaling the pixels to fit the destination size and converting the pixels to match the color type and alpha type.
member.returns: Returns on success, or if there was an error.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Pixels are copied only if pixel conversion is possible.
If the color type is <xref:SkiaSharp.SKColorType.Gray8>, or <xref:SkiaSharp.SKColorType.Alpha8>, the destination color type must match. If the color type is <xref:SkiaSharp.SKColorType.Gray8>, destination colorspace must also match.
If the alpha type is <xref:SkiaSharp.SKAlphaType.Opaque>, the destination alpha type must match.
If the colorspace is <see langword="null" />, the destination colorspace must also be <see langword="null" />.
Filter Quality:
- <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality.None> is fastest, typically implemented with nearest neighbor filter. - <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality.Low> is typically implemented with bilerp filter. - <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality.Medium> is typically implemented with bilerp filter, and mipmap when size is reduced. - <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFilterQuality.High> is slowest, typically implemented with the bicubic filter.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPixmap.ScalePixels(SkiaSharp.SKPixmap,SkiaSharp.SKSamplingOptions)
member.param: The destination pixmap.
The sampling options for scaling.
member.summary: Scales pixels to the destination using the specified sampling options.
member.returns: Returns on success.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKPngEncoderFilterFlags
member.summary: Various row filters to use when encoding a PNG.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKPngEncoderFilterFlags.AllFilters
member.summary: Try all the filters.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKPngEncoderFilterFlags.Avg
member.summary: Uses the average of the two neighboring pixels (left and above) to predict the value of a pixel: Average(x) = Raw(x) - floor((Raw(x-bpp)+Prior(x))/2).

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKPngEncoderFilterFlags.NoFilters
member.summary: Do not use any filters.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKPngEncoderFilterFlags.None
member.summary: Transmit unmodified.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKPngEncoderFilterFlags.Paeth
member.summary: Computes a simple linear function of the three neighboring pixels (left, above, upper left), then chooses as predictor the neighboring pixel closest to the computed value: Paeth(x) = Raw(x) - PaethPredictor(Raw(x-bpp), Prior(x), Prior(x-bpp)).

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKPngEncoderFilterFlags.Sub
member.summary: Transmits the difference between each byte and the value of the corresponding byte of the prior pixel: Sub(x) = Raw(x) - Raw(x-bpp).

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKPngEncoderFilterFlags.Up
member.summary: Transmits the difference between each byte and the value of the corresponding byte of the pixel above: Up(x) = Raw(x) - Prior(x).

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKPngEncoderOptions.FilterFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets the filtering flags.
member.value: The filtering flags.

remarks.para: If a single filter is chosen, then that filter will be used for every row.

If multiple filters are chosen, then a heuristic will be used to guess which filter will encode smallest, then apply that filter. This happens on a per row basis, different rows can use different filters.
Using a single filter (or less filters) is typically faster. Trying all of the filters may help minimize the output file size.

member.summary: A non-empty rounded rectangle with equal x-radii and equal y-radii.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKShader
member.summary: Shaders specify the source color(s) for what is being drawn in the .

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKShader.CreateBitmap(SkiaSharp.SKBitmap)
member.param: The bitmap to use inside the shader.
member.summary: Creates a new shader that will draw with the specified bitmap.
member.returns: Returns a new , or an empty shader on error. Never returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the bitmap cannot be used (has no pixels, or its dimensions exceed implementation limits) then an empty shader may be returned. If the source bitmap's color type is <xref:SkiaSharp.SKColorType.Alpha8> then that mask will be colorized using the color on the paint.

The tiling mode to use when sampling the bitmap in the y-direction.
member.summary: Creates a new shader that will draw with the specified bitmap.
member.returns: Returns a new , or an empty shader on error. Never returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the bitmap cannot be used (has no pixels, or its dimensions exceed implementation limits) then an empty shader may be returned. If the source bitmap's color type is <xref:SkiaSharp.SKColorType.Alpha8> then that mask will be colorized using the color on the paint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The tile rectangle represents the subset (or superset) of the picture used when building a tile. It is not affected by the local matrix and does not imply scaling (only translation and cropping).

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKShaderTileMode
member.summary: Indications on how the shader should handle drawing outside the original bounds.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKShaderTileMode.Clamp
member.summary: Replicate the edge color.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKShaderTileMode.Decal
member.summary: Only draw the shader's image in the original domain, returning transparent black elsewhere.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKShaderTileMode.Mirror
member.summary: Repeat the shader's image horizontally and vertically, alternating mirror images so that adjacent images always seam.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKShaderTileMode.Repeat
member.summary: Repeat the shader's image horizontally and vertically.

member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.remarks: Always dispose the object before you release your last reference to the . Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the finalizer.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKSurface.PeekPixels
member.summary: Returns the pixels, if they are available.
member.returns: Returns the pixels, if they are available, otherwise .
member.remarks: If the pixels are available, then the surface is only valid until the surface changes in any way, in which case the pixmap becomes invalid.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKSurface.PeekPixels(SkiaSharp.SKPixmap)
member.param: The pixmap to receive the pixel information.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKSvgCanvas
member.summary: A specialized which generates SVG commands from its draw calls.
member.remarks: The canvas may buffer some drawing calls, so the output is not guaranteed to be valid or complete until the canvas instance is deleted.

member.param: The initial SVG viewport (viewBox attribute on the root SVG element).
The SkiaSharp stream to write the SVG data to.
member.summary: Creates a new which generates SVG commands and writes them to the specified stream.
member.returns: Returns the new SVG canvas.
member.remarks: The canvas may buffer some drawing calls, so the output is not guaranteed to be valid or complete until the canvas instance is disposed. The stream must remain valid during the lifetime of the returned canvas.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKSvgCanvas.Create(SkiaSharp.SKRect,SkiaSharp.SKXmlWriter)
member.param: The initial SVG viewport (viewBox attribute on the root SVG element).
The writer to receive the XML data.
member.summary: Creates a new instance of which writes to the specified XML writer.
member.returns: Returns the new canvas.
member.remarks: Ownership of the XML writer is not transfered to the canvas, but it must stay valid during the lifetime of the returned canvas.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKSvgCanvas.Create(SkiaSharp.SKRect,System.IO.Stream)
member.param: The initial SVG viewport (viewBox attribute on the root SVG element).
The .NET stream to write the SVG data to.
member.summary: Creates a new which generates SVG commands and writes them to the specified .NET stream.
member.returns: Returns the new SVG canvas.
member.remarks: The canvas may buffer some drawing calls, so the output is not guaranteed to be valid or complete until the canvas instance is disposed. The stream must remain valid during the lifetime of the returned canvas.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKTransferFunctionBehavior
member.summary: Various flags to be used with .

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKTransferFunctionBehavior.Ignore
member.summary: Premultiplies, unpremultiplies, and blends ignoring the transfer function. Pixels are treated as if they are linear, regardless of their transfer function encoding.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKTransferFunctionBehavior.Respect
member.summary: Converts to a linear space before premultiplying, unpremultiplying, or blending.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKTrimPathEffectMode
member.summary: Represents the type of trimming to perform.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKTrimPathEffectMode.Inverted
member.summary: Remove the path between the start and stop, preserving [0, start] and [stop, 1].

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKTrimPathEffectMode.Normal
member.summary: Trim the path around the start and stop, preserving [start, stop].

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKTypeface
member.summary: Represents a specific typeface and intrinsic style of a font.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This is used in the paint, along with optionally algorithmic settings like <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPaint.TextSize?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPaint.TextSkewX?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPaint.TextScaleX?displayProperty=nameWithType>, and <xref:SkiaSharp.SKPaint.FakeBoldText?displayProperty=nameWithType> to specify how text appears when drawn (and measured).
Typeface objects are immutable, and so they can be shared between threads.

remarks.format:

A typeface is understood to be bold when the weight is greater than or equal to 600 or <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFontStyleWeight.SemiBold>.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKTypeface.IsFixedPitch
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the typeface claims to be fixed-pitch.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This does not guarentee that the advance widths will not vary as this is a style bit on the typeface.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKTypeface.IsItalic
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the typeface claims to be slanted.
member.value: if the typeface is italic or oblique; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
A typeface is understood to be italic when it has a slant of either <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFontStyleSlant.Italic> or <xref:SkiaSharp.SKFontStyleSlant.Oblique>.

remarks.param: If the compression is lossy, then the quality corresponds to the visual quality. Lower values are smaller, but will have reduced quality.
If the compression is lossless, then the quality corresponds effort put into compressing the file. Lower values are faster, but higher values have smaller files.

member.summary: The memory passed has not been initialized to zero, so the codec must write all zeros to memory.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKZeroInitialized.Yes
member.summary: The memory passed is zero initialized, so the codec may take advantage of this by skipping writing zeroes.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.Internals.IPlatformLock
member.summary: Defines a platform-specific reader-writer lock for thread synchronization.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.Internals.IPlatformLock.EnterReadLock
member.summary: Acquires a read lock, allowing multiple concurrent readers.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.Internals.IPlatformLock.EnterUpgradeableReadLock
member.summary: Acquires an upgradeable read lock that can later be upgraded to a write lock.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.Internals.IPlatformLock.EnterWriteLock
member.summary: Acquires a write lock, providing exclusive access.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.Internals.IPlatformLock.ExitReadLock
member.summary: Releases the read lock.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.Internals.IPlatformLock.ExitUpgradeableReadLock
member.summary: Releases the upgradeable read lock.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.Internals.IPlatformLock.ExitWriteLock
member.summary: Releases the write lock.
